vote.title: To authorize the Director of Recreation & Parks to appropriate $15,000.00 from the Neighborhood Economic Development fund in support of artwork for Feddersen Recreation Center.  ($15,000.00)
vote.description:
Explanation
BACKGROUND
This legislation authorizes the Director of Recreation & Parks to appropriate funding from the Neighborhood Economic Development fund to support the production of artwork for Feddersen Recreation Center. 
 
Feddersen Recreation Center is undergoing renovations of their basketball court and a mural will be commissioned for the surface of the court.  The Department of Development has agreed to let the Department of Recreation and Parks appropriate $15,000.00 from the Neighborhood Economic Development fund to aid with this effort.
 
FISCAL IMPACT:   Funding is available in the Neighborhood Economic Development fund (2237).
 
 
Title
To authorize the Director of Recreation & Parks to appropriate $15,000.00 from the Neighborhood Economic Development fund in support of artwork for Feddersen Recreation Center.  ($15,000.00)
 
 
Body
WHEREAS, Feddersen Recreation Center is undergoing renovations of their basketball court and a mural will be commissioned for the surface of the court; and   
 
WHEREAS, the Department of Development has agreed to let the Department of Recreation and Parks appropriate $15,000.00 from the Neighborhood Economic Development fund to aid with this effort; and 
 
WHEREAS, it has become necessary in the usual daily operations of the Department of Recreation and Parks to authorize the Director to appropriate these funds; NOW THEREFORE,
 
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
 
 
SECTION 1.                     That from the unappropriated monies and from all monies estimated to come into said fund from any and all sources and unappropriated for any other purpose during the fiscal year ended December 31, 2022, the sum of $15,000.00 is appropriated in Fund 2237 (Neighborhood Economic Development Fund), Dept-Div 51-01 (Recreation & Parks), in object class 03 (Services) per the account codes in the attachment to this ordinance.
 
SECTION 2.                     Funds are hereby deemed appropriated and transfers authorized to carry out the purposes of this ordinance and the City Auditor shall establish such accounting codes as necessary. 
 
SECTION 3.   That the City Auditor is authorized to make any accounting changes to revise the funding source for all contracts or contract modifications associated with this ordinance.    
 
SECTION 4.                     That this ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after the earliest period allowed by law.
